folder: Canal Street & Greene Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
317 to 331 Canal Street, north side, east of, adjoining, and at the east corner of Greene Street, which begins here.
1928.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Canal Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Canal Street, south side, west from Church Street, to West Broadway (6th Avenue "El" thereon). No. 1 is south-westward from Canal and Greene Streets and shows the easterly portion of this block and upon which in November 1938 will rise a new P.O. Station. This is the present west side of Church Street, from Canal to Lispenard Streets after widening. South of the latter point is the New York Telephone Building. View No. 2 is southward down Wooster Street and shows No's 358 to 366. These are included in the demolition for the aforementioned P.O. site. View No. 3 is extensive and shows the entire block front exclusive of the corner structure at Church Street (left).

June 23, 1933.
Views 1, 2 and 3

P.L. Sperr

folder: Church Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Church Street, west side, south from Canal (foreground), to Walker Streets, showing a vacant lot between Canal and Lispenard and the New York Telephone Building between the latter point and Walker Street. Upon the cleared space will rise a new Post Office station. The photographer is viewing southward from a vantage point at Canal and Greene Streets.

July 4, 1938.

P.L. Sperr
